data.enText: a person who works in an office, working for another person, dealing with letters and telephone calls, typing, keeping records, arranging meetings with people, etc.
Please contact my secretary to make an appointment.
data.chText: 请和我的秘书联系，预约一个时间。

data.enText: an official of a club, society, etc. who deals with writing letters, keeping records, and making business arrangements
the head of a government department, chosen by the President
(in Britain) an assistant of a government minister, an ambassador , etc.

simple_means.memory_skill: secret adj.秘密的 + -ary 从事...的人

tr: a person to whom a secret is entrusted
an assistant who handles correspondence and clerical work for a boss or an organization
a person who is head of an administrative department of government

value.def: A secretary is a person who is employed to do office work, such as typing letters, answering phone calls, and arranging meetings.

example.ex: My grandfather was secretary of the Scottish Miners' Union.
example.tran: 我的祖父是苏格兰矿工工会干事。

value.def: The secretary of an organization such as a trade union, a political party, or a club is its official manager.
value.tran: (工会、政党、俱乐部等的)干事,书记员

value.def: The secretary of a company is the person who has the legal duty of keeping the company's records.

example.tran: 国防部长卡斯珀·温伯格

value.def: Secretary is used in the titles of ministers and officials who are in charge of main government departments.

trans: 资深秘书；高級秘書；高级秘书；高级文秘
常务秘书；常任秘书长；常任秘书；常务次官；常务次长
州务卿；国务卿；美国国务卿；国务大臣；州务卿办公室
(大型国际组织、政治组织的)秘书长，总干事，总书记
财政部长；美国财政部长；财务部长；财长；财政部部长
秘书长；总书记；总干事；總書記
常务副国务卿；副部长；副国务卿；副秘书；副书记
